intro: Oreopanax pariahuancae, commonly known as the Andean arrow leaf, is a rare evergreen shrub native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound, arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments at high altitudes. Its botanical features include a woody stem and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Oreopanax pariahuancae is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological traits.
